metadata.title: Power Platform App Maker Associate
metadata.subtitle: Build apps with Microsoft Power Platform
metadata.description: Master Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI for creating business applications. Prepare for the PL-100 certification exam.

overview.summary: Power Platform App Maker Associate training teaches you to create business applications using Microsoft Power Platform. Learn to build canvas apps, model-driven apps, automate workflows, and create business intelligence solutions.
overview.targetAudience: Business analysts, developers, and IT professionals who want to create business applications using Microsoft Power Platform and prepare for the PL-100 certification exam.

modules.title: Power Platform Fundamentals
modules.description: Understand Power Platform components and capabilities

sections.content:
Microsoft Power Platform Overview

Power Platform enables anyone to create business applications without extensive coding. Learn the core components and how they work together.

sections.title: Power Platform Components
items: Power Apps for building custom applications
Power BI for data analysis and visualization

sections.content: Power Apps allows you to build professional applications quickly. Learn to create both canvas apps (pixel-perfect designs) and model-driven apps (data-focused).

faq.question: Do I need programming experience?
faq.answer: No, Power Platform is designed for low-code/no-code development. Basic Excel skills and understanding of business processes are helpful.

faq.question: What Microsoft 365 license do I need?
faq.answer: You'll need a Microsoft 365 license with Power Apps and Power Automate included. Power BI Pro may be needed for advanced features.

faq.question: Can I build mobile apps?
faq.answer: Yes, Power Apps can create responsive applications that work on phones, tablets, and desktops. You'll learn to design for multiple devices.

faq.question: Is this course hands-on?
faq.answer: Yes, extensive hands-on labs where you'll build complete business applications, automated workflows, and data visualizations.
